channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet Dot: DoorDash’s new 5-foot, 350-pound robot delivery driver that can hit 20 mph
item.description: Dot’s creators are convinced it's ready to take on the world despite its innocent look.

item.title: Trump administration slashes $7.6 billion for clean energy projects in blue states
item.description: The Trump administration is canceling $7.6 billion in grants that supported hundreds of clean energy projects in 16 states, all of which voted for Dem...

item.title: Elon Musk’s big week, from spurring a Netflix cancelation wave to blowing out EV sales estimates; Tesla stock falls
item.description: Tesla stock closed Thursday down 4.5% to $439 amid skepticism the new number really signals a turnaround given all the anti-Musk backlash.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway buys OxyChem for $9.7 billion
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway is buying Occidental Petroleum’s chemical division for $9.7 billion in what may be the last big acquisition involving the consummat...

item.title: OpenAI Just Hit a $500 Billion Valuation After Selling Shares to SoftBank: Report
item.description: OpenAI employees sold shares in a deal that saw the company’s valuation grow from $300 billion in a matter of weeks.

item.title: Tech leads market near records while D.C.’s shutdown stalls jobs data
item.description: U.S. stocks are drifting around their records on Thursday as technology stocks keep rising and as Wall Street keeps ignoring the shutdown of the U.S. ...

item.title: Musk reports Tesla sales jump 7% after months of boycotts
item.description: Six months after Elon Musk left the Trump administration to the great relief of Tesla investors worried about boycotts , the world’s richest man has a...

item.title: Why Casio Just Launched an AI-Powered Emotional Support Guinea Pig
item.description: The robot is called Moflin. It costs $429— and it’s adorable.

item.title: Gen Z, millennials, and Republicans drive trust in media to the lowest ever recorded, a shocking collapse of 40 percentage points since 1972
item.description: Trust in media has never been lower, Gallup says. A shocking 70% of U.S. adults have “not very much” confidence or “none at all” in what they see and ...

item.title: ‘I don’t know why I need to go to college’: Ford CEO says his Gen Z son worked as a mechanic and wondered if the 4-year degree was still worth it
item.description: Jim Farley hosted a panel with Mike Rowe, who said, "nothing in the history of western civilization has gotten more expensive, more quickly" than coll...

item.title: 3 Things Keeping Employers Up at Night
item.description: Company leaders across the U.S. are worried about how the economic and political climate is impacting workers.

item.title: Why it Might Pay to Be ‘Playful’ at Work
item.description: Play isn’t just for kids — a study shows how the trait can build rapport with colleagues.

item.title: Your office might be noticeably empty on Oct. 3 thanks to Taylor Swift’s new album release, study shows
item.description: More than one-third of U.S. workers (36%) identify as a Swiftie, a BambooHR study shows.

item.title: Mortgage lending may never look the same after FICO’s latest shake-up
item.description: Investors are celebrating a major shake-up in how FICO scores will be shared with mortgage lenders, as shares of parent company Fair Isaac Corp. have ...

item.title: Meta Will Soon Personalize Ads Based on What Users Type Into Its AI Tools
item.description: The AI-based changes include Facebook and Instagram and will go into effect in December.
